Context:
Program Name: Honours Bachelor of Commerce (Digital Marketing)
Code: B312
Credential: Honours Bachelor's Degree
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 4 years (8 semesters) plus 1 co-op work term
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $7,455.00 *
International Tuition: $20,357.00 **
Location: St. James Campus
Experiential Learning: Yes
Fall 2023 Delivery: Semester 1: On Campus
Winter 2024 Delivery: Semester 1, 2: On Campus
Program Overview: The Honours Bachelor of Commerce (Digital Marketing) degree assembles technology and personalized experiences in marketing. Students will develop essential skills and competencies in business concepts during the first two years, followed by analyzing and applying digital marketing concepts and practices in the final two years.
Graduates will succeed in a field that has transformed how products and services are marketed and harness the power of the internet to conquer modern marketing challenges.
The program includes two foundational years common to other business degree programs, followed by two years in which students specialize in digital marketing.

* Domestic tuition fee for the first year
** International tuition fee for the first year

Context:
The George Brown College offers an Honours Bachelor of Commerce (Digital Marketing) program with a curriculum that includes two foundational years common to other business degree programs, followed by two years focused on digital marketing specializations in owned media and social media. Students complete capstone courses and a work placement semester in the final two years. The college requires students in this program to bring their own laptops due to its Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) initiative.

Students have access to networking opportunities through guest lectures, business and marketing events, competitions, and on-campus clubs. They also complete a co-op paid work term.

George Brown Marketing students can benefit from membership in two Canadian marketing associations, the CMA and IAB, included in their tuition fees:

- The CMA (Canadian Marketing Association) offers live and online events with discounted member pricing, professional development opportunities, resources and guides, networking chances through CMA NXT, and access to exclusive content.
- The IAB (Interactive Advertising Bureau) provides student volunteer opportunities for marquee events, members only webinars and podcasts, original Canadian digital marketing research, globally accepted digital ad standards, and globally standardized courses, certification, and custom workshops.

Graduates of the program are prepared to work in digital marketing roles in various sectors, including for-profit and not-for-profit organizations, professional associations, academic settings, and consultancies.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Honours Bachelor of Commerce (Digital Marketing) Program B312 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The Honours Bachelor of Commerce (Digital Marketing) degree is designed to develop students' understanding and application of business in a global market, digital marketing across various industries, and scholarship using diverse research methods. Graduates will possess critical thinking, innovation, creativity, entrepreneurial and business acumen, problem-solving skills, and the ability to ideate and innovate.

Industry applications: Start-ups, small, medium, and large businesses, agencies, consulting firms.

Advanced standing for students who have completed an Ontario College Diploma in Business-Marketing with a GPA of 3.0 or higher can be awarded, allowing direct entry into the third year of the Honours Bachelor of Commerce (Digital Marketing) degree. Graduates may pursue further study options in master's level courses at various post-secondary institutions across Canada.

Required courses for Semesters 1 and 2 include:
- Semester 1: BBUS 1001 - Canadian Business Fundamentals, BMTH 1003 - Financial Mathematics, BBUS 1006 - Microeconomics: Canada in the Global Environment, BCOM 1001 - Applied Business Communication, BCMP 2007 - Business Management Information Systems.
- Semester 2: BBUS 1002 - Marketing Management, BACC 1002 - Introduction to Financial Accounting, BBUS 1007 - Macroeconomics: Canada in the Global Environment, BBUS 1106 - Organizational Behaviour, BBUS 1009 - Critical Thinking and Problem Solving.
- Semester 3 onwards: BCDM 1001 - Marketing Strategy, BACC 2003 - Financial Accounting II (presumably).

Context:
Program Offering: This college offers a program with digital media evaluation and use of tools, problem-solving, marketing storytelling, business discipline evaluation, and one work experience semester or equivalent.

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition (first two semesters, Fall 2022): $7,455.00
- International Tuition (first two semesters, Fall 2023): $20,357.00
- Additional costs (first two semesters, Fall 2022): Not included in the text
- International Students: Visit the International Fees and Related Costs page for more information.

Financial Assistance: The program is approved for OSAP funding.

Admission Requirements: Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma with six Grade 12 University (U) or University/College (M) courses, including Grade 12 (U) English and math, with a minimum grade of 60% in all prerequisite courses. Mature students may apply if they are 19 years old or older without an OSSD and meet the English and math requirements.

Year(s): Programs starting in Fall 2022, Fall 2023, and later dates.

Disclaimer: The information is subject to change without notice. Students must verify George Brown College fee requirements.

Context:
* Post-secondary courses in English and mathematics will be considered for certain programs, with a requirement of 12 credits or higher in English and 65% or higher in math.
* Mature applicants must have the English and math credits required, but meeting the minimum requirements does not guarantee admission to the program.
* English language proficiency requirements: George Brown College ESL Level 9; TOEFL 84 overall and 21 in each skill band (online); IELTS 6.5 overall and 6.0 in each skill band; MELAB 85; CAEL overall 70 (writing 60).
* Some college and university credits may qualify for exemptions, more information can be found on the Transfer Guide.
* George Brown College has been granted consent by the Ministry of Colleges and Universities to offer an applied degree.
* International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
* Information sessions are held regularly on campus, domestic students can sign up for an upcoming session through the provided link.
* For inquiries about domestic admission requirements and deadlines, contact the college.
